original_title: A Study of Form Through Movement
overview: We never think about being efficient in the way we move. A Study of Form Through Movement takes inspiration from Frank and Lillian Gilbrethâ€™s theories on time and movement efficiency as it attempts to depict the final form of a specific action. The final form of movement is something the naked eye cannot see, which is why it is represented here by the changing jumbles of lines; each line sequence is different as each follows a distinct activity.
title: A Study of Form Through Movement
